item.title: Beside 121 Overbury Street, 8th August
item.description:
The overgrown trees and hedges to be cut down please. When it starts to get this overgrown this is when rodents start creeping through again

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Overbury Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the corner of Betterton St and Drury Lane, 8th August
item.description:
On Wednesday 6th August, about 6:30pm, a large coach, registration number NV23 DTU, drove down Betterton St and turned left into Drury Lane. It was far too large to make the turning and it totally uprooted the metal bollard on that corner, leaving it in an unsafe condition. Having caused the damage it drove off. I believe the driver or owner of the coach should be held responsible for the damage and be made to pay for it, not local tax payers. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Betterton Street, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Partially dead/dying tree, 8th August
item.description:
This cherry blossom tree right outside my property is now dying. There are many dead branches, some small but also others which are big and overhanging my property. I am concerned that if we have any strong wind the branches throughout the tree but especially the very heavy ones could fall causing a major accident. My drive is in constant use and I have become very concerned. Also, there are always cars parked right up to the tree daily with many people in and out of these cars. My concern is not just for the occupants of 28 whitmore but for others walking past or parking.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitmore Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Exeter Road, close to Kilburn Station, outside Cedar Lodge, 8th August
item.description:
The litter on the pavement has not been cleaned since 20th June, and the dead leaves have been there since early June. I had been picking up pieces of litter until recently, otherwise the pavement would be looking even worse than it is.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Exeter Road, London

item.title: Drug paraphernalia in Tile Kiln Lane N13., 8th August
item.description:
Both sides of Tile Kiln Lane need to be swept for general litter but on the pavement opposite Oakthorpe Primary School there is evidence on drug taking. There are many nitrous oxide canisters & also balloons. Hopefully this will be cleared before the children go back in September. Not a good example for them!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tile Kiln Lane, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet
